original_title: Sri Lanka stocks trade up mid-day
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks were up during mid-day trade on Wednesday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.04 percent, or 4.54 points, at 10,512.
However, the S&P SL20 index of liquid stocks was down 0.10 percent, or 2.83 points at 2,969.
This was mainly made up of one major transaction; a crossing of 21 million Capital Alliance Plc shares (Rs 1.3 bn).
Top contributors to the ASPI included Sampath Bank Plc (up at 67.00), Aitken Spence Plc (up at 120.00), and Hayleys Plc (up at 75.70). (Colombo/Nov22/2023)
